item.title: Maggie add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I believe that everything happens for a reason. People change so that you can learn to let go, things go wrong so that you appreciate them when they're right, you believe lies so you eventually learn to trust no one but yourself, and sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "A wise girl kisses but doesn't love, listens but doesn't believe, and leaves before she is left." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Bette Midler
item.description: "Give a girl the right shoes, and she can conquer the world." -- Bette Midler

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "She was a girl who knew how to be happy even when she was sad. And that’s important—you know " -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Timothy Leary
item.description: "Women who seek to be equal with men lack ambition." -- Timothy Leary

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "I believe in pink. I believe that laughing is the best calorie burner. I believe in kissing, kissing a lot. I believe in being strong when everything seems to be going wrong. I believe that happy girls are the prettiest girls. I believe that tomorrow is another day and I believe in miracles." -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "I was born with an enormous need for affection, and a terrible need to give it." -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "That's why I write, because life never works except in retrospect. You can't control life, at least you can control your version." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Lauren Groff
item.description: "Depressing thought: my friends were the girls I ate lunch with, all buddies from kindergarten who knew one another so well we weren't sure if we even liked one another anymore." -- Lauren Groff

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Meg Cabot
item.description: "Someday you're really going to have to describe to me in more detail what life is like on the planet you live on. Because it sounds really great, and I'd like to visit there one day." -- Meg Cabot

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Meg Cabot
item.description: "I wonder what it's like to live in Tinaville. I get the feeling it's very shiny there." -- Meg Cabot

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Brian Morton
item.description: "What you are is a complicated girl with simple needs. You need your books and time to read, and you need a few friends and you need someone-not to take care of you, but to care for you. If you have all those things, you'll always be alright." -- Brian Morton

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Randy Murray
item.description: "A writer is a dangerous friend. Everything you say, all of your life and experience, is fodder for our writing. We mean you no harm, but what you know and what you’ve done is unavoidably fascinating to us. Being friends with a writer is a bit like trying to keep a bear as a pet. They’re wonderful, friendly creatures, but they play rough and they don’t know their own strength or remember that they have claws. Choose the stories you tell to your writer friends carefully." -- Randy Murray

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "May your coming year be filled with magic and dreams and good madness. I hope you read some fine books and kiss someone who thinks you're wonderful, and don't forget to make some art -- write or draw or build or sing or live as only you can. And I hope, somewhere in the next year, you surprise yourself." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "You never have to change anything you got up in the middle of the night to write." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Maggie add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of. " -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Writing isn't about making money, getting famous, getting dates, getting laid, or making friends. In the end, it's about enriching the lives of those who will read your work, and enriching your own life, as well. It's about getting up, getting well, and getting over. Getting happy, okay? Getting happy." -- Stephen King

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Two hours of writing fiction leaves this writer completely drained. For those two hours he has been in a different place with totally different people." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Ann Brashares
item.description: "I was supposed to write a romantic comedy, but my characters broke up." -- Ann Brashares

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "The truth is, everyone is going to hurt you. You just got to find the ones worth suffering for." -- Bob Marley

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Taylor Swift
item.description: "When I was a little girl I used to read fairy tales. In fairy tales you meet Prince Charming and he's everything you ever wanted. In fairy tales the bad guy is very easy to spot. The bad guy is always wearing a black cape so you always know who he is. Then you grow up and you realize that Prince Charming is not as easy to find as you thought. You realize the bad guy is not wearing a black cape and he's not easy to spot; he's really funny, and he makes you laugh, and he has perfect hair." -- Taylor Swift
